snippet: A government plan to resettle Muslim minorities who cannot meet strict standards for naturalized citizenship has spurred a major exodus, rights groups say.
abstract: Human rights groups say plan by government of Myanmar to resettle an estimated one million Rohingya people, members of Muslim minority who cannot meet strict standards for naturalized citizenship, has spurred largest mass exodus of Rohingya refugees since 2012; more than 14,500 have fled to Thailand in past three weeks alone; humanitarian crisis is embarrassment to United States ahead of scheduled visit by Pres Obama, as his administration has considered Myanmar a foreign-policy success.
lead_paragraph: A government plan to resettle Muslim minorities who cannot meet strict standards for naturalized citizenship has spurred a major exodus, rights groups say.

headline.main: Myanmar Policy’s Message to Muslims: Get Out
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Policy’s Message to Muslims: Get Out

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
